name: Eduardo Blanco 0002
content: Eduardo Blanco | Eduardo Blanco. Natural Language Processing. Computational Linguistics. Computational Semantics. I am an Associate Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Arizona. I am also affiliated with Applied Math and Cognitive Science. My primary research interests lie in natural language processing with an emphasis on computational semantics. I am a member of the Computational Language Understanding Lab and the NLP cluster at the University of Arizona. I sometimes tweet. For the cool work coming out of the lab, check out @labclu. News I gave a talk in the 2023 College of Science Lecture Series on Myth Busting Science Serving as Senior Area Chair for EMNLP 2025 Serving as Senior Area Chair for NAACL 2025 Serving as Action Editor for Computational Linguistics Serving as Action Editor for ACL Rolling Review Fall 2022: I moved to beautiful Tucson and joined the University of Arizona 2019: Bloomberg Data Science Research Grant 2019: NSF CAREER Award
